title: Transcutaneous vagus nerve stimulation (tVNS) for the treatment of major depressive disorder: a systematic review and meta-analysis
keyFinding: Transcutaneous VNS demonstrated significant antidepressant effects compared to sham stimulation, with moderate effect sizes across pooled analyses.

title: A randomized controlled trial of chronic vagus nerve stimulation for treatment of medically intractable seizures
keyFinding: High-stimulation VNS produced a significantly greater reduction in seizure frequency (28%) compared to low-stimulation controls (15%) in drug-resistant epilepsy.

title: Transcutaneous auricular vagus nerve stimulation in patients with major depressive disorder: a randomized controlled trial
keyFinding: Four weeks of taVNS significantly reduced Hamilton Depression Rating Scale scores compared to sham, with a response rate of 37.5% versus 12.5% in controls.

title: Non-invasive vagus nerve stimulation for the treatment of acute migraine: a randomized, double-blind, sham-controlled study
keyFinding: Non-invasive cervical VNS was safe and well-tolerated for acute migraine treatment, though the primary endpoint of pain-free status at 2 hours did not reach significance versus sham.

title: Vagus nerve stimulation inhibits cytokine production and attenuates the severity of rheumatoid arthritis
journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
keyFinding: Implanted VNS significantly inhibited TNF production and improved clinical signs in rheumatoid arthritis patients, providing direct evidence of the inflammatory reflex in humans.

title: Safety and efficacy of vagus nerve stimulation for the treatment of treatment-resistant depression: a systematic review and meta-analysis
keyFinding: VNS for treatment-resistant depression showed significant response and remission rates across 177 studies, with an acceptable safety profile and mild, transient adverse events.

title: Transcutaneous auricular vagus nerve stimulation for the treatment of insomnia: a randomized controlled trial
keyFinding: Four weeks of taVNS significantly improved Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index scores and sleep efficiency in patients with chronic insomnia compared to sham stimulation.

title: Vagus nerve stimulation for drug-resistant epilepsy: a European long-term study up to 24 months in 347 children
keyFinding: Long-term VNS in paediatric epilepsy showed progressive improvement over 24 months, with 32% of patients achieving at least 50% seizure reduction.

title: Transcutaneous vagus nerve stimulation modulates default mode network in major depressive disorder
keyFinding: taVNS modulated functional connectivity in the default mode network and showed antidepressant effects, suggesting a central mechanism for its therapeutic action in depression.

title: Vagus nerve stimulation paired with rehabilitation for upper limb motor function after ischaemic stroke (VNS-REHAB): a randomised, blinded, pivotal, device trial
keyFinding: VNS paired with rehabilitation significantly improved upper limb motor function compared to rehabilitation with sham stimulation in chronic stroke patients at 90 days.

title: Transcutaneous vagus nerve stimulation for posttraumatic stress disorder: a pilot randomized controlled trial
keyFinding: Transcutaneous cervical VNS reduced PTSD symptom severity and showed promising effects on autonomic regulation in veterans with combat-related PTSD.

title: Chronic vagus nerve stimulation in Crohn's disease: a 6-month follow-up pilot study
keyFinding: Chronic VNS improved clinical and biological markers of Crohn's disease in 5 of 7 patients over 6 months, supporting the role of the cholinergic anti-inflammatory pathway.

title: Transcutaneous auricular vagus nerve stimulation for the treatment of generalized anxiety disorder: a randomized controlled trial
keyFinding: taVNS significantly reduced Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale scores compared to sham over 8 weeks, with treatment response rates of 46.5% versus 20.9% in controls.

title: Autonomic regulation therapy via left or right cervical vagus nerve stimulation in patients with chronic heart failure: results of the ANTHEM-HF trial
keyFinding: Chronic VNS was safe and improved left ventricular ejection fraction, heart rate variability, and six-minute walk distance in patients with symptomatic heart failure.

title: Transcutaneous vagus nerve stimulation for tinnitus: a randomized clinical trial
keyFinding: Transcutaneous auricular VNS combined with sound therapy reduced tinnitus severity scores significantly more than sound therapy alone over 8 weeks.

title: Vagus nerve stimulation for the treatment of epilepsy: a meta-analysis of efficacy and predictors of response
keyFinding: VNS reduced seizure frequency by at least 50% in approximately half of patients with drug-resistant epilepsy, with greater efficacy observed in generalised versus partial seizures.

title: Non-invasive vagus nerve stimulation for fibromyalgia: a randomized controlled trial
keyFinding: Transcutaneous auricular VNS significantly reduced pain severity and improved quality of life in fibromyalgia patients compared to sham over 4 weeks of treatment.

title: Closed-loop vagus nerve stimulation paired with tones for the treatment of post-traumatic stress disorder: a randomized, double-blind, sham-controlled trial
keyFinding: Paired VNS with auditory tones significantly reduced PTSD symptom severity and enhanced fear extinction learning compared to sham stimulation in combat veterans.

title: Effects of transcutaneous auricular vagus nerve stimulation on anxiety in healthy volunteers: a randomized, sham-controlled crossover study
keyFinding: Single-session taVNS reduced state anxiety and attenuated cortisol stress responses in healthy volunteers compared to sham, suggesting an anxiolytic mechanism via vagal afferent pathways.

title: Neural effects of transcutaneous vagus nerve stimulation on gastric motility in healthy volunteers
keyFinding: taVNS significantly enhanced gastric motility and increased vagal efferent activity as measured by electrogastrography, supporting its therapeutic potential for gastrointestinal disorders.
